newsitem.title: UK: Cadcentre to raise 7.2 million stg via listing.
newsitem.headline: Cadcentre to raise 7.2 million stg via listing.

text.p: British computer systems maker Cadcentre Group Plc on Thursday released a prospectus for its application for a full listing on the London Stock Exchange.
Cadcentre plans to raise 7.2 million stg through the placement of 6.34 million shares priced at 200p each, giving a market capitalisation of 33.2 million stg.

"The new funds raised for Cadcentre will enable us to accelerate our rate of international expansion and benefit from exciting opportunities for growth," chief executive Crispin Gray said in a statement.
The placing is being sponsored by Albert E. Sharp.

The funds would be used to redeem preference shares worth 1.8 million stg, repay a 1.9 million stg institutional loan, repay 1.5 million stg of bank borrowings and raise 2.0 million stg in new capital for sales and marketing, the company said.
In the year ended March 31, 1996, Cadcentre's turnover rose 19 percent to 14.2 million stg. Profit before tax amounted to 1.67 million stg against 557,000 stg in 1995.
Dealings in the new shares is expected to commence on December 5 1996. -- Sonali Verma, London Newsroom +44 171 542 7954
